beers.desc: Original Sin Bourbon Barrel is a chocolate treasure-trove with deep boubon barrel overtones. The dark malt complexity of this imperial stout gives way to notes of milky mocha coffee, vanilla, and dark chocolate. Layered in between are soft, gentle aromas of warm caramels and praline with big flavours of oak and walnut from one year in wood. It’s long, lingering finish is utterly sinful.
beers.name: Original Sin Bourbon Barrel By Rackhouse

beers.desc: This beer taught us that patience truly is a virtue. KBS is a big imperial stout brewed with a massive amount of coffee and chocolate and then bourbon barrel-aged to perfection. Incredibly silky and full-bodied with notes of vanilla, cocoa, roasted coffee and charred oak.
beers.name: Kentucky Breakfast Stout (KBS)

beers.desc: MASSIVE! Bourbon Barrel Aged Barley Wine has spent about the past two years in Heaven Hill Bourbon barrels from Kentucky. This barrel-aged barleywine is described as offering a huge and complex aroma and flavor with notes of maple syrup, burnt toffee, plum, boysenberry, vanilla, rich and spicy wood. Enjoy the richness and intensity now, or after years and years and years more of aging.
beers.name: MASSIVE! (Bourbon Barrel Aged) (2016)

beers.desc: Time to take another trip to fourth dimension! Seriously dry hopped with Citra, Strata and Mosaic Lupomax hops. Cheers!
beers.name: Tesseract

beers.desc: Brewed with a clean yeast strain and Mosaic Cryo- and Citra Lupomax hops
beers.name: Christmas On Fire

beers.desc: Vår batch #100. For å feire brygget vi en skikkelig frisk og kraftig humlet pale ale, uten å gå på kompromiss med letdrikkeligheten. Humlet med Mosaic, Citra og Chinook. Gjær: A38 Juice
beers.name: Lupulicious

beers.desc: Christmas oat cream DIPA. Hops: Citra incognito, Citra, Talus, Vista. Lactose
beers.name: Supernova 2.0

beers.desc: Rodenbach Alexander is a blend of 2/3rd aged Rodenbach (2 year matured beer from oak standing Foeders) and 1/3rd young ale, then macerated with sour cherries.
beers.name: Alexander

beers.desc: We raided Grandma’s recipe box and then got a little weird with it of course, so we stuffed Lemon Bar Slang Du Jour with lemon, pear, a little banana, vanilla soft serve ice cream, granola and a whole pile of shortbread cookies for a lemon bar flavor that’s totally Grandma approved!
beers.name: Slang Du Jour - Lemon Bar

beers.desc: The beer that we dreamt about for a long time, from days when the brewery was just a twinkle in our minds eye. Choosing our finest Saison from foudre no.2 and wine barriques, we blended in a large portion of Belgian Lambic that has been aging at Burning Sky. Refined, complex and spritzy, this beer can be enjoyed now or left to age further.
beers.name: Cuvée (2020)

beers.desc: Cheesecake sour brewed with Maltgarden, those dessert lovers from Poland. It's thick and biscuity, sweet and tart. Enjoy by itself or with a slice of actual cheesecake! Water, Barley (Gluten), Oats, Wheat (Gluten), Strawberry Puree, Raspberry Puree, Lactose (Milk Sugar), Vanilla, Biscuit Essence, Yeast, Hops
beers.name: Dyplomata

beers.desc: Another fruit explosion in our ongoing collaboration series together with our friends at The Veil Brewing Co. in Virginia, US. This triple fruited Imperial Gose is intensely saturated with vibrant raspberries, soft peaches and a delicate marshmallow treatment to complete the party. Comes in a 33 cl can. Contains milk sugar.
beers.name: Tefnut Raspberry Peach Marshmallow

beers.desc: Paragon Off the rack Rum barrel. BARLEY WINE AGED IN RUM BARRELS FOR 18 months. The augmented vanilla notes in this very limited beer is owed to 12 months of ageing in fresh rum barrels. Hidden within are flavours of coconut, nutmeg, and fruit that give way to toffee, molasses and anise with a spirit-forward finish.
beers.name: Paragon Off the Rack Rum Barrel By Rackhouse

beers.desc: A true Geuze. A blend of 1, 2, and 3 year-old lambic unfiltered and unpasteurized and aged in the bottle for at least 6 months after blending. Continued fermentation in the bottle give this Geuze its famous champagne-like spritziness. The lambic that goes into it is brewed only with 60% barley malt, 40% unmalted wheat, aged hops, and water, spontaneously fermented by wild yeasts, and matured in oak casks.
beers.name: 3 Fonteinen Oude Geuze

beers.desc: Sister to Alyson not Agnes, Sarah is the perfect combination of sweet and sass – the soft florality of ripe fruit, and the zesty twangs that give raspberries and cranberries their lasting impact – a blend of tart, acidic berries with premium quality honey. She is at once complex yet approachable, multi-faceted and integrated. She can hang out with a good book after dinner on her own, or she plays well with others, including roasted poultry, cheese courses, and spinach salads.
beers.name: Sarah

beers.desc: Sister to Alyson not Agnes, Sarah is the perfect combination of sweet and sass – the soft florality of ripe fruit, and the zesty twangs that give raspberries and cranberries their lasting impact – a blend of tart, acidic berries with premium quality honey. She is at once complex yet approachable, multi-faceted and integrated. She can hang out with a good book after dinner on her own, or she plays well with others, including roasted poultry, cheese courses, and spinach salads.
beers.name: Sarah

beers.desc: Cloudy, pale yellow color with a white head. Citrus (lemon) aroma, mild bitterness. Well carbonated.
beers.name: Saison d'Erpe-Mere

beers.desc: With 30% of the grist made up of wheat malt and an elevated level of sulphate in the mash, expect our take on an American Wheat to be crisp and crushable with heaps of pithy citrus and pine.
beers.name: Every Day Is A Different Dose

beers.desc: Nelson Saison is a blend of beers produced in June and December 2019 from turbid mashes. The June brew used aged Nelson Sauvin as the bittering hop and was fermented in a 500 litre ex-cider butt, producing a beer with wonderful balance, delicate acidity and aromas of fresh cut grass. The December brew used fresh Nelson Sauvin and Motueka hops in the boil, before fermentation in small white Burgundy barrels. This produced a firmly acidic beer with aromas of gooseberry, lime and vanilla. The finished beer was blended in January 2022 and dry-hopped with more fresh Nelson Sauvin before bottling. The beer matured for a further five months in bottle before release.
beers.name: Nelson Saison

beers.desc: Nora tells of ancient history, nomadic people and pyramids, spices and Kamut®, which means “the soul of the earth” in ancient Egyptian. Its warm, orange-amber color is complemented by a tall head which releases notes of Eastern aromas, ginger and citrus fruit.NORA scents and sweetly balanced taste are ideal to accompany spicy ethnic dishes, cured meats and cheeses, artichokes and asparagus.
beers.name: NORA

beers.desc: Pure Icelandic glacier water and a classic witbier recipe combine to create our Icelandic White Ale. Crafted clean and crisp, the balanced addition of orange peel, coriander, and rolled oats ensure this beer remains incredibly ﬂavorful and refreshingly drinkable.
beers.name: Icelandic White Ale

beers.desc: Mørk lager
beers.name: Klappe Zu, Affe Tot
